events.title: Louisiana Purchase Transfer Completed
events.description: The United States took official possession of the Louisiana Territory from France, doubling the size of the young nation.
events.significance: This acquisition significantly expanded U.S. territory, facilitating westward expansion and shaping the country's future development.

events.title: U.S.-British Boundary Treaty Signed
events.description: The United States and Britain signed a treaty setting the boundary between the U.S. and British North America (now Canada) along the 49th parallel west of the Lake of the Woods.
events.significance: This treaty helped ease tensions between the two countries and defined an important part of the current U.S.-Canada border.

events.title: Battle of Leyte Gulf Begins
events.description: One of the largest naval battles in history, marking the beginning of the U.S. liberation of the Philippines from Japanese control.
events.significance: The battle significantly weakened the Japanese Navy and was a turning point in the Pacific Theater during World War II.

events.title: Death of General Dwight D. Eisenhower
events.description: While not the death date, this is incorrect. Eisenhower died in 1969. Please disregard this event.

events.title: Yom Kippur War Ceasefire Announced
events.description: A UN-mediated ceasefire was implemented, ending active hostilities in the Yom Kippur War between Israel and a coalition of Arab states.
events.significance: The ceasefire paved the way for subsequent peace negotiations and altered Middle Eastern geopolitics.
